title: Logotype and accompanying faces
content:
Howdy folk, we're launching an on-screen design studio.  
The approach was to keep a friendly, approachable spin while having something that could play nicely in more serious/sensible surrounds.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816162824im_/http:/typophile.com/files/supernaut_5811.jpg)

Appreciate thoughts and feedback on letter shape/weighting.

Would also love some typeface recommends to sit with it.  
Our current view sees some contrasting pairs used, i.e, VAG and Corona

Any and all welcome and appreciated.
author: Ratbaggy

comments.content:
You already know about Ernestine. :-)

What about Stone's singular Silica?  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/stone/silica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130816162824/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stone/silica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/stone/silica/")

hhp
Ernestine would be a good choice here, or maybe Archer.

Archer is more congenial and better if you have a lot of text, Ernestine is more industrial and better onscreen. I'll resist discussing which has a far cooler Italic. :-)

Disclaimer: I had a hand in the latter.

hhp

Yeah. Know and love Ernestine, I wonder if it's to same having (essentially) two serifs.

Think the mark is working ok though? I wonder whether there's something off with the p/e ... but can't put my finger on it.

Someone pointed out that the S looks like it's falling backwards ever so slightly ... and now, I can't unsee it.

Very good pick up.
